author: Canadian Press
title: Warming trend forecast for West after record freeze, snow in forecast for Vancouver
text:
A warming trend is in the forecast for much of British Columbia after several days of record-breaking temperatures, but the cold weather on the Prairies will continue.
Environment Canada says temperatures are rising but snow flurries are in the forecast for the Metro Vancouver area, followed by rain later this week and temperatures well above zero degrees Celsius.
Temperatures in Alberta are forecast to start to moderate today and through the week, but it will remain cold.
Calgary and Edmonton have been experiencing wind chills as high as -50 C over the weekend, but Environment Canada says the daily low temperatures will drop to -21 C.
Environment Canada says despite the somewhat warmer temperatures in Alberta, frostbite warnings will remain in effect.
B.C.'s public power utility, BC Hydro, says the extreme cold drove peak hourly electricity demand across the province to a record high on Friday night, reaching 11,300 megawatts.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Jan. 15, 2024.
The Canadian Press

author: Listin Diario
title: La muerte de los vivos
text:
Ideas Puntuales
La muerte de los vivos
Hace unos años, 29 de octubre de 2022 para ser más exactos, perdí a una de mis madres. Hay personas afortunadas que vienen con dos madres a este mundo, soy una de esas. Escribo de ella porque ayer mientras hablaba con mis hermanas sobre su muerte, les explicaba que hablar sobre alguien que ya no está, recordar las cosas que hemos vivido, hace que con el tiempo duela menos, es como si nuestras palabras la van colocando en un lugar de paz y nos permite tener paz a nosotras.
Con los muertos es todo más fácil porque no hay reciprocidad, nos toca a nosotros despedirnos con las terapias o métodos que consideremos adecuados, pero es mucho más difícil decirle adiós a alguien que está en vida y con la que compartimos momentos importantes.
Despedirse de quien ya no quiere compartir su tiempo con nosotros, en especial dándole forma a la enemistad, es frustrante y doloroso.
Honro a todos los que se han separado sin una despedida a la altura. El orgullo nos lleva a lugares que a veces necesitamos, en especial a la soledad.

author: ceskenoviny.cz
title: Ground News - The crisis had to come, now we have risen, David Kaše praised | Českénoviny.cz
text:
Summary by ceskenoviny.cz Hradec Králové - Three wins from the last four games, five points in a row or eleven goals scored in three days. These are statistics indicating that hockey's Litvinov is returning to the saddle again after a crisis period. “We are showing good performances,” striker David Kaše praised himself when talking to journalists after today's successful performance of the North Bohemians in Hradec Králové. author: newsdirectory3
title: Pennsylvania Road Crews Battle Heavy Snowfall
text:
Pennsylvania Braces for Winter Weather⁤ After Mild 2022 State officials urge​ residents to prepare​ for potential snow ‌and ice as temperatures drop.
Pennsylvania​ residents are being urged to⁤ prepare for a possibly snowy winter after a milder-than-usual 2022.While last year saw ⁤below-average snowfall in many areas, including⁤ northwest Pennsylvania, experts predict a⁣ return to more typical ⁤winter conditions​ this⁢ year.
“we’re expecting a more average winter this year,” said [Name], a spokesperson for ​the Pennsylvania department of ⁣Transportation. “That⁢ means we coudl see significant snowfall and icy conditions,⁢ especially in ⁢the northern ⁣and⁤ western parts of ⁤the ​state.”
[Image: A snowplow clearing a road in Pennsylvania]
The department is already gearing up for the winter season, ensuring snowplows are ⁤ready and salt supplies are stocked. ‌They are also reminding residents to⁢ take steps to prepare⁣ thier vehicles⁣ and‍ homes for the ‌colder months.
“Make sure ⁣your car is winterized, with good tires and antifreeze,” [Name] advised. “And don’t forget ⁢to ​stock up on essentials like shovels, salt, and ‍blankets ‌in case of power outages.”
While the exact ⁢amount of snowfall remains uncertain,officials ⁣are ‍encouraging residents to stay informed about weather forecasts and take necessary precautions.”We want everyone to stay safe this winter,” [Name] emphasized. ⁣”By being prepared and‌ staying aware​ of the conditions, we can all enjoy a safe and happy‍ holiday‍ season.”
Preparing for a More Typical Winter in Pennsylvania NewsDirectory3.com Exclusive Interview
After a surprisingly mild 2022, Pennsylvania residents are bracing for ​a return to average winter conditions this year. With potential ​for important snowfall and⁤ icy conditions, state officials are urging residents to prepare ‌early.
We spoke with [name],⁣ a spokesperson for teh Pennsylvania Department of Transportation, ​who emphasized the importance of proactive⁢ readiness.
“We’re expecting a more average winter this year,” [Name] ⁢explained. “That means we could see significant snowfall and icy conditions, especially in the northern and western parts of ‍the ⁣state.”
The Department of Transportation is actively preparing ‍for the winter season,ensuring snowplows are in top condition and salt supplies are fully⁢ stocked.
[Name] offered⁢ some key tips for residents: “Make ⁤sure your car is winterized, with​ good​ tires and⁤ antifreeze. And don’t forget to stock up on essentials like shovels, salt, ‍and blankets in case of power outages.”
While the amount of​ snowfall‍ remains uncertain, ‌staying informed about weather⁢ forecasts and taking necessary precautions is crucial.⁣
“[Name] concluded: “We‍ want everyone to stay safe ⁣this⁢ winter. By being prepared and staying ⁢aware of the⁤ conditions,we can all enjoy a safe and happy holiday season.”

author: Admin
title: San Jose Tow Service Revolutionizes Roadside Assistance Experience
text:
San Jose Tow Service announced its unparalleled commitment to revolutionizing the roadside assistance experience for drivers in San Jose and beyond. With a steadfast dedication to excellence, innovation, and integrity, San Jose Tow Service stands as a beacon of reliability and professionalism in the towing industry.
Since its inception in 2000, San Jose Tow Service has been more than just a towing company; it has been a trusted partner for drivers in need, offering prompt and reliable services 24/7. The company’s ethos of customer satisfaction has been the driving force behind its exponential growth and success, making it the go-to choice for individuals and businesses alike.
“At San Jose Tow Service, we believe in the power of innovation to change the world,” said the Founder/CEO of San Jose Tow. “Our journey began with a simple yet profound mission: to offer unparalleled services that make a significant difference in our community and beyond. Today, we stand as a testament to that mission, continually striving to exceed expectations and set new standards in the industry.”
What sets San Jose Tow Service apart is its unique blend of traditional values and forward-thinking strategies. The company’s commitment to sustainability, community engagement, and ethical practices permeates every aspect of its operations, ensuring a positive impact on both its clients and the community at large.
San Jose Tow Service offers a comprehensive range of services to meet the diverse needs of its clients, including:
-
Flatbed towing
-
24-hour towing
-
Jumpstart
-
Tire changes
-
Car battery replacement
-
Gas refueling services
-
Lockout services
-
Motorcycle towing
-
Truck towing
-
Roadside assistance
-
Long-distance towing
-
Medium duty towing
-
Emergency recovery
-
Drop-shipment service
-
Forklift services
-
Container towing (20 and 40 feet)
-
Box truck towing
-
Tractor towing
-
RV towing services
-
Commercial towing
-
Heavy-duty towing
-
Semi towing
-
Truck and trailer towing
-
Crane service
-
Rotator towing services
-
Towing and recovery
-
Lowboy towing
San Jose Tow Service is committed to delivering the most powerful services for every vehicle, ensuring that clients can rest assured knowing their needs will be met quickly and efficiently. Whether it’s long-distance towing or roadside assistance, the company’s qualified team of professionals brings unparalleled experience and attention to detail to every job.
For more information about San Jose Tow Service and its range of services, please visit
https://sanjosetowservice.com/.
About San Jose Tow Service:
San Jose Tow Service is a leading provider of towing and roadside assistance solutions in San Jose, California. With a focus on excellence, innovation, and integrity, the company is dedicated to delivering prompt and reliable services 24/7. Established in 2000, San Jose Tow Service has grown to become a trusted partner for drivers in need, offering a comprehensive range of towing and roadside assistance services to meet diverse needs.

author: Spectrum News Staff
title: DeSantis declares emergency for 54 Florida counties
text:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. — Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis declared an emergency in 54 counties Thursday ahead of a potential storm in the Gulf of Mexico.
Counties affected by the declaration include:
Alachua, Baker, Bay, Bradford, Calhoun, Charlotte, Citrus, Clay, Collier, Columbia, Dixie, Duval, Escambia, Flagler, Franklin, Gadsden, Gilchrist, Gulf, Hamilton, Hernando, Hillsborough, Holmes, Jackson, Jefferson, Lafayette, Lake, Lee, Leon, Levy, Liberty, Madison, Manatee, Marion, Monroe, Nassau, Okaloosa, Orange, Osceola, Pasco, Pinellas, Polk, Putnam, Santa Rosa, Sarasota, Seminole, St. Johns, Sumter, Suwannee, Taylor, Union, Volusia, Wakulla, Walton, and Washington counties.
The order comes as tropical wave Invest 97L "is producing a large area of disorganized showers and thunderstorms over Hispaniola, Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands," DeSantis' executive order said.
The order said that conditions are favorable for Invest 97L to develop into a tropical depression over the weekend and early next week "over the eastern Gulf of Mexico near the Florida Peninsula."
Based on meteorological reports, the emergency declaration said that there is a "significant threat of heavy rainfall over most of the State of Florida, with the possibility of at least twelve (12) inches of rainfall over the next seven (7) days."
It is expected that any "prolonged heavy rainfall" from the potential storm could result in "river flooding, coastal flooding, erosion, and gusty winds."
